page.title: 15TRANSPORT PAISLEY
page.content: The Hurlet Road is a busy winding road joining Paisley to the outskirts of Glasgow at Nitshill. There have been a number of accidents on this road. These are due to the sharp bends, the narrowness of the road and the fact that there is no pavement beside the road.The speed limit is 60m.p.h. Strathclyde Regional Council has decided to straighten the road and make it into a Dual Carriageway. The project will take 4 to 5 months. One of the main problems for the road builders has been drainage as parts used to flood easily.Many drains have been built to take away rain water and a "French Drain" has been built to drain spring water from the road. It is made up of a layer of thick gravel at the bottom on which a plastic drainage tube is placed, covered by a layer of lighter gravel.
